Qubell Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2013-08-27  | Version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT
Overview
  • Introduction
  • Goals
  • Usage

Project Documentation
  • Project Information
  • Project Reports

qubell:destroy-instance

Full name:

com.qubell.maven:qubell-maven-plugin:1.0-SNAPSHOT:destroy-instance

Description:

Destroys the Qubell application instance and waits instance to be in "Destroyed" state Could use either instance, created by launch-instance step or the one, provided in configuration.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
apiPassword String - API password
User property is: apiPassword.
apiURL URL - Base URL for Qubell API including API version
example: https://express.qubell.com/
User property is: apiURL.
apiUsername String - Username for API
Note: cannot be OAuth username (such as Google account)
User property is: apiUsername.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
bypassSSLCheck Boolean - Whether SSL certificate check has to be bypassed. Use this option for self-signed certificates.
Default value is: false.
User property is: bypassSSLCheck.
instanceId String - Instance id if no launch-instance step was executed before
User property is: instanceId.
logApiPayload Boolean - If set to true, API request/response pairs will be logged into standard out
Default value is: false.
User property is: logApiPayload.
name String - (no description)
Default value is: destroy.
User property is: name.
outputRelativePath String - Path for file where instance output parameters will be saved
User property is: outputRelativePath.
parameters String - Custom parameters for the execution, represents a raw JSON map Example { "paramName" : "paramValue" }
Default value is: {}.
User property is: parameters.
project MavenProject - Current maven project, used to store values between MOJOs
Default value is: ${project}.
statusPollingInterval Integer - Interval for instance status polling. Value is specified in seconds.
Default value is: 5.
User property is: statusPollingInterval.
statusWaitTimeout Integer - Wait timeout for instance, turning into target status
Default value is: 60.
User property is: statusWaitTimeout.

Parameter Details

apiPassword:

API password
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • User Property: apiPassword

apiURL:

Base URL for Qubell API including API version
example: https://express.qubell.com/
  • Type: java.net.URL
  • Required: Yes
  • User Property: apiURL

apiUsername:

Username for API
Note: cannot be OAuth username (such as Google account)
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • User Property: apiUsername

bypassSSLCheck:

Whether SSL certificate check has to be bypassed. Use this option for self-signed certificates.
  • Type: java.lang.Boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: bypassSSLCheck
  • Default: false

instanceId:

Instance id if no launch-instance step was executed before
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: instanceId

logApiPayload:

If set to true, API request/response pairs will be logged into standard out
  • Type: java.lang.Boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: logApiPayload
  • Default: false

name:

(no description)
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: name
  • Default: destroy

outputRelativePath:

Path for file where instance output parameters will be saved
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: outputRelativePath

parameters:

Custom parameters for the execution, represents a raw JSON map Example { "paramName" : "paramValue" }
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: parameters
  • Default: {}

project:

Current maven project, used to store values between MOJOs
  • Type: org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject
  • Required: No
  • Default: ${project}

statusPollingInterval:

Interval for instance status polling. Value is specified in seconds.
  • Type: java.lang.Integer
  • Required: No
  • User Property: statusPollingInterval
  • Default: 5

statusWaitTimeout:

Wait timeout for instance, turning into target status
  • Type: java.lang.Integer
  • Required: No
  • User Property: statusWaitTimeout
  • Default: 60
